data.title: bd-14g: fix flaky ID generation due to terseid hash validation
data.description:
terseid's parse_id rejects 4+ char hashes that contain no digits, but 
the base36 hash function can occasionally produce all-letter output.
This caused intermittent test failures in test_review_id_format and 
test_thread_id_format.

Fix: Added generate_valid_id() that retries with a new random seed if 
the candidate doesn't pass parse_id validation. Added stress test 
(500 iterations) to verify reliability.

Changes:
- src/events/ids.rs: Added generate_valid_id() retry wrapper, 
  updated new_review_id() and new_thread_id() to use it, added 
  test_generated_ids_always_valid stress test

data.reason: Security LGTM. Reviewed retry loop for DoS (bounded at 100, probability of exhaustion negligible), RNG quality (getrandom/OS entropy), ID space reduction (negligible), and information leakage (none). No security concerns.
